definitions.definition: Firmly or securely fixed in place; stable.
definitions.example: That rope is dangerously loose. Make it fast!

definitions.definition: Firm against attack; fortified by nature or art; impregnable; strong.
(of people) Steadfast, with unwavering feeling. (Now mostly in set phrases like fast friend(s).)
Moving with great speed, or capable of doing so; swift, rapid.
definitions.example: I am going to buy a fast car.

definitions.definition: Causing unusual rapidity of play or action.
(of a piece of hardware) Able to transfer data in a short period of time.
Deep or sound (of sleep); fast asleep (of people).
(of dyes or colours) Not running or fading when subjected to detrimental conditions such as wetness or intense light; permanent.
definitions.example: All the washing has come out pink. That red tee-shirt was not fast.

definitions.definition: Having an extravagant lifestyle or immoral habits.
Ahead of the correct time or schedule.
definitions.example: There must be something wrong with the hall clock. It is always fast.

definitions.definition: (of photographic film) More sensitive to light than average.
In a firm or secure manner, securely; in such a way as not to be moved; safe, sound .
definitions.example: Hold this rope as fast as you can.

definitions.definition: Immediately following in place or time; close, very near .
definitions.example: Fast by the sturdy batsman the ball unheeded sped. / That ain't my style, said Casey. Strike one, the umpire said.

definitions.definition: Quickly, with great speed; within a short time .
definitions.example: Do it as fast as you can.

definitions.definition: Ahead of the correct time or schedule.
definitions.example: I think my watch is running fast.

definitions.definition: One who fasts, or voluntarily refrains from eating.
